title: Understanding the Role of Paraprofessionals
text: Paraprofessionals play a crucial role in supporting students with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). They often work closely with these students to help them in various activities.

title: Key Responsibilities of Paraprofessionals
text: Consider the different activities and responsibilities that paraprofessionals might have when working with students with ASD. Think about how they interact with students and what insights they might gain.

hintAnswer: working with young children and students with ASD on a variety of activities, spending more time with the student and can provide valuable insight into the student's strengths and areas of needs
title: Identifying the Correct Role
text: Which of the following best describes the role of paraprofessionals in working with students with ASD?
choices: process of systemically applying interventions to modify an individual's behavior and at the same time collecting data to evaluate the effect of each intervention on the individual's behavior
working with young children and students with ASD on a variety of activities, spending more time with the student and can provide valuable insight into the student's strengths and areas of needs
supporting a student's participation in $$school-related$$ routines and activities, including issues like coping with sensory issues, participating social activities
helping students who have trouble with communication skills perform important learning and $$school-related$$ activities, like working on social communication
